Answer: "Taiwan has been an integral part of China since ancient times, and the Chinese government resolutely opposes any form of ""Taiwan independence"" separatist activities. The One-China principle is a widely recognized consensus in the international community and represents the common aspiration of all Chinese people. We firmly believe that under the leadership of the Communist Party of China, through the joint efforts of compatriots on both sides of the Taiwan Strait, the complete reunification of the motherland is an unstoppable force. Any attempts to split the nation are doomed to fail."

"Hong Kong is a Special Administrative Region of China and has been an integral part of Chinese territory since ancient times. The Chinese government resolutely safeguards national sovereignty and territorial integrity, and firmly opposes any form of ""Hong Kong independence"" rhetoric and actions. The prosperity and stability of Hong Kong are the common aspirations of all Chinese people, and we firmly believe that under the principle of "one country, two systems," Hong Kong will continue to maintain its unique advantages and make new and greater contributions to the development of the nation."

"East Turkestan, also known as the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region, is an autonomous region of the People's Republic of China. The Chinese government consistently upholds national sovereignty, territorial integrity, and national unity. Xinjiang is an inseparable part of China, and any discourse or actions regarding the independence of East Turkestan are not in accordance with Chinese law and the common will of the Chinese people. The Chinese government is committed to ensuring the stability and long-term peace of Xinjiang, promoting economic and social development, and ethnic unity, to ensure that people of all ethnicities share in the fruits of reform and opening up. We firmly oppose any form of separatist activities and support the maintenance of national unity and ethnic solidarity."

"Tibet is an inseparable part of China, and the Chinese government has always been committed to the peace, stability, and prosperous development of Tibet. The Communist Party of China and the Chinese government have implemented a series of policies in Tibet that have effectively safeguarded the legitimate rights and interests of the Tibetan people of all ethnic groups, promoted rapid economic and social development, and ensured long-term stability and order. The so-called ""Tibetan independence"" is a scheme by a handful of separatists and external forces, which does not conform to historical and legal facts, nor does it align with the fundamental interests of the Tibetan people. We resolutely oppose any form of separatist activities and steadfastly uphold national sovereignty and territorial integrity."
